_comments._overview: Theme configuration system - controls theme UI controls visibility and default values for branded deployments
_comments.ui: UI control visibility settings - determines which theme controls appear in the application header
_comments.ui.showThemeSelector: Show/hide the theme selector dropdown in header. Controls access to 47+ available color themes (cosmic-night, elegant-luxury, etc.)
_comments.ui.showFontToggle: Show/hide the font selection menu in header. Controls access to 24+ available fonts (Inter, Poppins, etc.)
_comments.ui.showThemeToggle: Show/hide the dark/light mode toggle button in header. Controls manual dark mode switching.
_comments.defaults: Default/forced theme values - overrides user preferences for branded deployments
_comments.defaults.theme: Force a specific color theme (e.g., 'cosmic-night', 'elegant-luxury'). null = user choice via localStorage. When set, users cannot change theme.
_comments.defaults.font: Force a specific font (e.g., 'inter', 'poppins'). null = theme default or user preference. When set, users cannot change font.
_comments.defaults.darkMode: Force dark/light mode. true=always dark, false=always light, null=system preference or user choice. When set, users cannot toggle mode.
_comments._priority: Configuration priority: forced defaults (highest) > user localStorage > system defaults (lowest)
_comments._validation: All configured values are validated against available themes/fonts. Invalid values fall back to defaults with error logging.
_comments._usage: Used by ThemeProvider, Header component, and theme context to control theme system behavior across the application.
